results.name: Fundamental positive solution y = y2(n) of the second class of the Pell equation x^2 - 2*y^2 = A001132(n), n >= 1, (primes congruent to 1 or 7 mod 8).
comment: The corresponding terms x = x2(n) are given in A254930(n).

The y2-sequence for the second class for the primes congruent to 1 (mod 8), which are given in A007519, is 2*A254763. For the primes congruent to 7 (mod 8), given in A007522, the y2-sequence is A254929.
For comments and the Nagell reference see A254760.
formula: A254930(n)^2 - 2*a(n)^2 = A001132(n), and a(n) is the second largest (proper) positive integer satisfying this (generalized) Pell equation.
example: See A254930 for the first pairs (x2(n), y2(n)).
mathematica: Reap[For[p = 2, p < 1000, p = NextPrime[p], If[MatchQ[Mod[p, 8], 1|7], rp = Reduce[x > 0 && y > 0 && x^2 - 2 y^2 == p, {x, y}, Integers]; If[rp =!= False, xy = {x, y} /. {ToRules[rp /. C[1] -> 1]}; y2 = xy[[-1, 2]] // Simplify; Print[y2]; Sow[y2]]]]][[2, 1]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 28 2019 *)
